title: Republican SEC Commissioner Roisman to Leave Agency
sub_head: Resignation will give Democrats bigger majority at Wall Street watchdog
body:
Securities and Exchange Commission member Elad Roisman plans to leave the market regulator by the end of January, giving Democrats a bigger majority at an agency pursuing an ambitious and sometimes politically divisive policy agenda.
Mr. Roisman joined the five-member SEC as a Republican commissioner in September 2018, having served as chief counsel for Republicans on the Senate Banking Committee before that. He briefly served as the SECâ€™s acting chairman at the end of the Trump administration.
